label: A4B12C3_oF76_69_2g_cf2gl_ag-001
title: Orthorhombic Bi$_{4}$Ti$_{3}$O$_{12}$ $m = 3$ Aurivillius Structure
comments:
Aurivillius phases are layered tetragonal materials with composition (Me$'_{2}$O$_{2}$)$^{2+}$(Me$_{m-1}$R$_{m}$O$_{3m+1}$)$^{2-}$ (Me$_{m-1}$Me$'_{2}$R$_{m}$O$_{3(m+1)}$), where Me and Me' are metals and R is a transition metal with a charge of +4 or +5. (Subbaro, 1962) 
 This is the original structural determination by (Aurivillius, 1949). It should not be confused with the \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B12C3_oC76_41_2b_6b_ab-001}{obsolete $m=3$ Aurivillius structure in space group $Aea2$ \#41}.
